headline: Reliance, Inc. Announces Appointment of John G. Sznewajs to Board of Directors
summary: PHOENIX, Oct. 01, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Reliance, Inc. (NYSE: RS) today announced the appointment of John G. Sznewajs, 58, as an independent member of the Company’s Board of Directors. Mr. Sznewajs’ term took effect on October 1, 2025 and will expire at the Company’s 2026 Annual Meeting of Stockholders. Following the appointment of Mr. Sznewajs, Reliance’s Board will be comprised of nine members, eight of whom are independent. "We are thrilled to have John join our Board,” said Douglas Stotla

raw.headline: Reliance, Inc. Announces Appointment of John G. Sznewajs to Board of Directors
raw.summary: PHOENIX, Oct. 01, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Reliance, Inc. (NYSE: RS) today announced the appointment of John G. Sznewajs, 58, as an independent member of the Company’s Board of Directors. Mr. Sznewajs’ term took effect on October 1, 2025 and will expire at the Company’s 2026 Annual Meeting of Stockholders. Following the appointment of Mr. Sznewajs, Reliance’s Board will be comprised of nine members, eight of whom are independent. "We are thrilled to have John join our Board,” said Douglas Stotla

headline: 1 Mid-Cap Stock to Target This Week and 2 We Turn Down
summary: Mid-cap stocks have the best odds of scaling into $100 billion corporations thanks to their tested business models and large addressable markets. But the many opportunities in front of them attract significant competition, spanning from industry behemoths with seemingly infinite resources to small, nimble players with chips on their shoulders.

raw.headline: 1 Mid-Cap Stock to Target This Week and 2 We Turn Down

headline: 1 Profitable Stock with Exciting Potential and 2 We Find Risky
summary: Even if a company is profitable, it doesn’t always mean it’s a great investment. Some struggle to maintain growth, face looming threats, or fail to reinvest wisely, limiting their future potential.

raw.headline: 1 Profitable Stock with Exciting Potential and 2 We Find Risky
raw.summary: Even if a company is profitable, it doesn’t always mean it’s a great investment. Some struggle to maintain growth, face looming threats, or fail to reinvest wisely, limiting their future potential.
